{{anglosaxon infobox | name=Eoh | image= | caption= | people=[[wikipedia:Angles (tribe)|Angle]] | pronun= | othernames=''Évar'' ([[Qenya|Q]])
''Echos'' ([[Gnomish|G]])
''Elvas'' ([[Gothic|Go]]) | titles= | position= | location=[[wikipedia:Anglia (peninsula)|Anglia]] | affiliation= | language=[[Old English]] | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death=[[wikipedia:5th century|5th century AD]] | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage=[[Heden]] | siblings=[[Beorn (son of Heden)|Beorn]] | spouse= | children=[[Eriol]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Eoh''' was the father of [[Eriol]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''. == History == Eoh lived somewhere in the [[wikipedia:5th century|5th century]] [[wikipedia:Anglia (peninsula)|Anglia]], being a descendant of sea-faring ancestors, some of whom visited [[Valinor]] by the way of [[Olórë Mallë]] in their sleep.{{LT1|I}}, p. 20 His home had a castle with a great tower, and a river running underneath it.{{LT2|I}}, pp. 4-5 He had a son called Ottor, who would later become known as ''Eriol'', inheriting his ancestors' sea-longing. However, sometime during Eriol's childhood, Eoh's home was attacked by his brother [[Beorn (son of Heden)|Beorn]], where both Eriol's mother and Eoh died, with Eoh being killed by Beorn himself in a "bitter fight about the walls".In another note, Eoh's death was either "in the siege" or "in a great battle".{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''10''', p. 290 His grandsons, [[Hengest]] and [[Horsa]], later avenged his death. == Etymology == The name ''Eoh'' is in [[Old English]], being a poetic word for "horse".{{LT1|In}}, pp. 23-4 == Other names == Eoh's name in [[Qenya]] was '''''Évar''''', with '''''Echos''''' being its [[Gnomish]] equivalent. The character was also called '''''Elvas''''' in [[Gothic]], ''Elvas'' probably being a dialectal or archaic form of the Gothic word ''aílvs'' ("horse") - from which the Qenya and Gnomish equivalents of the name were probably derived from. An alternative Qenya name for Eoh was '''''Eqar'''''.{{PE|15}}, "[[Names and Required Alterations]]", Appendix, ''Text IX'', pp. 16-7 == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | | | WOD | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |WOD=[[wikipedia:Odin|Wóden]]}} {{familytree | | | |:| | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |}} {{familytree | | | |:| | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |}} {{familytree | | | HED | | | | | | | | | | | | | | TUL | | | | VAL |HED=[[Heden]]|TUL=[[Tulkastor]]|VAL=[[Valwë]]}} {{familytree | |,|-|^|-|.| | | | | | | | | | | |,|-|^|-|.| | | |!| |}} {{familytree | BEO | | EOH | | | | | | | | | | SIB | | VAI |~| LIN |BEO=[[Beorn (son of Heden)|Beorn]]

[[wikipedia:5th century|5th century]]''}} {{familytree/end}} * The name of Hendwine's mother is not Naimi but ''[[Nelmir]]'' in the text on which the basis of his inclusion is founded upon - neither is her relation to [[Lindo]] and [[Vairë (wife of Lindo)|Vairë]] elaborated on.{{PE|15}}, "[[Names and Required Alterations]]", Appendix, ''Text X'', p. 17 == Other versions of the legendarium == In an early, rejected sketch, a more elaborate version of the attack on Eoh's home is given, in which Beorn attacked his brother's castle and killed him, ''and'' took Eriol captive - from which Eriol eventually escaped.{{LT2|VI}}, p. 294 {{references|notes}} [[Category:Angles]] [[Category:Characters in The Book of Lost Tales]] [[Category:Old English names]] [[Category:Rulers in the Great Lands]]
